content: Is it possible to run miri for rustc? I just made a change to the compiler and it always segfaults when building stage1 std. I already reviewed all the unsafe code blocks I have added and I have no clue how those could be unsound. I think using miri would be helpful, but I don't know if it was possible to run miri for rustc.
Not sure how to run Miri, but it might be helpful to use gdb to see how it segfaults

Building libstd using rustc in miri would take several days I would guess and would fail as soon as it hits LLVM. (If the sigsegv happens before hitting LLVM, the later doesn't matter of course, but the former does)
sigsegv happens when building libcore. It happens when executing a query.
